result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM - cases called - 21CF257 and 22CF66.  Defendant James Brian Sladek appeared in court.  Kristopher R. Ellis appeared on behalf of the Defendant in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions Atty Ellis regarding appearance in 22CF66.  Response by Atty Ellis - can appear specially.  Officer Deputy Conner Monk duly sworn and testifies in 21CF257.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Deputy Monk.  No cross by Atty Ellis.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of prior OWI.  Court takes judicial notice.  Argument by Atty Ellis.  Rebuttal by Atty Polzin.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue in 21CF257.  Statement by Atty Ellis - in receipt of complaint in 22CF66 - waive reading - waive time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Argument by State as to bond in 22CF66.  Response by Atty Ellis.  Court sets bond in 22CF66.  Court accepts waiver of time limits in 22CF66.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
